newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks seen in volatile tug-of-war.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks seen in volatile tug-of-war.

text.p: Caracas shares were seen trading in a volatile day of push-me pull-you as the positive force of growing foreign interest squared off against profit-taking and high interest rates, traders said.
"Under normal conditions and on a normal day, the bolsa would fall on profit-taking and yesterday's rise in interest rates," said one trader.
"But if foreign bids remain as strong as they have been recently, the market could well continue to rise," he added.
On Wednesday, the market's 19-share index hit historical highs, rising 0.62 percent to close at 4,610.37.
Nearly 14 million shares traded worth 2.2 billion bolivars ($4.7 million) as the market surfed through a five percentage point back-up in interest rates at Wednesday's auction of TEMs.
The record high followed a week of consistent gains.
"Profit-taking is more than likely among recent out- performers, such as Mavesa and Envases Venezolanos," said one broker.
